tab_content.accordion_title: Can I talk to a doctor on Maple about my premature ejaculation?
tab_content.accordion_intro: Yes. In most cases, a doctor on Maple can treat premature ejaculation online by asking about your symptoms and ordering tests if required. The doctor can provide a diagnosis, write necessary prescriptions, and recommend an appropriate course of treatment. If the doctor suspects you have a more serious problem, they may suggest for you to go to a clinic for a thorough physical examination.

tab_content.accordion_title: Can I get a prescription on Maple?
tab_content.accordion_intro: Yes, our physicians can prescribe medications online during your consultation. Once you accept a prescription, you’ll have the option to pick it up from any pharmacy or to have it delivered right to your door at no additional cost.
tab_content.accordion_content: You can visit our How it Works page to learn more.

tab_content.accordion_intro: Premature ejaculation occurs when a man ejaculates during intercourse sooner than they’d like. It’s fairly common, with 30% to 40% of men experiencing it at some point in their life. It’s only a health concern when it occurs on a regular basis or when it affects sexual intimacy.

tab_content.accordion_title: What are the symptoms of premature ejaculation?
tab_content.accordion_intro:
• Ejaculating within one minute of penetration most or all of the time
  • Inability to delay ejaculation during sexual intercourse

tab_content.accordion_title: How can I treat premature ejaculation?
tab_content.accordion_intro: Doctors may be able to prescribe medication which can help delay ejaculation. This can include anaesthetic creams like benzocaine or lidocaine. Additionally, doctors can prescribe oral prescriptions which can help delay ejaculation, like antidepressants or analgesics.

With Maple, you can start consulting with a doctor about your symptoms in a matter of minutes. We’re a healthcare app for fast, convenient 24/7 access to Canadian doctors.

You simply log in, tap a button to request a consultation, and we’ll immediately connect you to a doctor via live chat or video.

Our doctors can assess symptoms, and provide treatment, including prescriptions as necessary.
tab_content.accordion_content: You can visit our How it Works page to learn more.
